Detailed Description

Macro Definition Documentation

◆ AM_BLE_NUM_PATCH_CMP_TRIALS

#define AM_BLE_NUM_PATCH_CMP_TRIALS   5000

Patch complete can also take some time.

◆ AM_BLE_NUM_PATCH_TRIALS

#define AM_BLE_NUM_PATCH_TRIALS   5000

The BLE core takes a little while to wake up from a fresh boot, which means that the patch_apply function might time-out on the first few tries. Set this variable to let it try again for a finite number of trials.

◆ AM_BLE_STATUS_TIMEOUT

#define AM_BLE_STATUS_TIMEOUT   300

How long the MCU should wait for SPI_STATUS before assuming the BLE core is busy (measured in 10 us increments).

◆ AM_BLE_TX_PACKET_SPACING_US

#define AM_BLE_TX_PACKET_SPACING_US   1

SPI "options"

These values affect the behavior of the BLE HAL in regards to the SPI bus, but end users aren't likely to need to modify them. They are collected here for testing and debugging purposes. The amount of extra delay to add between successive SPI TX packets (in microseconds).

◆ AM_BLEIF_INT_B2MACTIVE

#define AM_BLEIF_INT_B2MACTIVE   AM_REG_BLEIF_INTEN_B2MACTIVE_M

The B2M_STATE went into the active state.

◆ AM_BLEIF_INT_CQUPD

#define AM_BLEIF_INT_CQUPD   AM_REG_BLEIF_INTEN_CQUPD_M

CQ write operation performed a register write with the register address bit 0 set to 1. The low address bits in the CQ address fields are unused and bit 0 can be used to trigger an interrupt to indicate when this register write is performed by the CQ operation.

◆ AM_BLEIF_INT_DCMP

◆ am_hal_ble_buffer

#define am_hal_ble_buffer (   A)
Value:
union \
{ \
uint32_t words[(A + 3) >> 2]; \
uint8_t bytes[A]; \
}

◆ AM_HAL_BLE_CHK_HANDLE

#define AM_HAL_BLE_CHK_HANDLE (   h)
Value:
((h) && ((am_hal_handle_prefix_t *)(h))->s.bInit \
&& (((am_hal_handle_prefix_t *)(h))->s.magic == AM_HAL_MAGIC_BLE))
AM_HAL_MAGIC_BLE
#define AM_HAL_MAGIC_BLE
Private types.

CQ write operation performed a register write with the register address bit 0 set to 1. The low address bits in the CQ address fields are unused and bit 0 can be used to trigger an interrupt to indicate when this register write is performed by the CQ operation.

#define AM_HAL_BLE_SET_BD_ADDR_OPCODE   0xFC32

Vendor Specific commands.

Note
Lengths are reported as "4 + <parameter length>". Each vendor-specific header is 4 bytes long. This definition allows the macro version of the length to be used in all BLE APIs.

#define WHILE_TIMEOUT_MS (   expr,
  timeout,
  error 
)
Value:
{ \
uint32_t ui32Timeout = 0; \
while (expr) \
{ \
if (ui32Timeout >= (timeout * 1000)) \
{ \
return error; \
} \
\
delay_us(1); \
ui32Timeout++; \
} \
}

Enumeration Type Documentation

◆ am_ble_status_e

enum am_ble_status_e

BLE-specific status values.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_BLE_STATUS_BUS_BUSY 

This error occurs when an HCI read or write function is called while another HCI communication function is already in progress.

AM_HAL_BLE_STATUS_IRQ_LOW 

This error happens when the MCU tries to execute an HCI read, but the BLE core hasn't asserted the BLEIRQ line. Try waiting for a BLEIRQ interrupt, or polling the BLECIRQ bit in the BSTATUS register before calling an HCI read function.

AM_HAL_BLE_STATUS_SPI_NOT_READY 

This error means that the MCU tried to execute an HCI write, but the BLE core didn't assert its SPI_STATUS signal within the allotted timeout. This might mean that there has been some error inside the BLE core. This may require a reboot of the BLE core.

AM_HAL_BLE_REQUESTING_READ 

This error means we were trying to write, but the BLE core has requested a READ instead. We will need to perform a read before we can retry this write.

AM_HAL_BLE_NO_HCI_RESPONSE 

We are expecting an HCI response to a packet we just sent, but the BLE core isn't asserting BLEIRQ. Its software may have crashed, and it may need to restart.

AM_HAL_BLE_FEATURE_DISABLED 

Any of these errors indicate a problem with the BLE hardware that requires a complete restart.

AM_HAL_BLE_SHUTDOWN_FAILED 
AM_HAL_BLE_REGULATOR_FAILED 
AM_HAL_BLE_POWERUP_INCOMPLETE 
AM_HAL_BLE_HCI_PACKET_INCOMPLETE 
AM_HAL_BLE_FIFO_ERROR 
AM_HAL_BLE_32K_CLOCK_UNSTABLE 
AM_HAL_BLE_STATUS_BUS_BUSY 

This error occurs when an HCI read or write function is called while another HCI communication function is already in progress.

AM_HAL_BLE_STATUS_IRQ_LOW 

This error happens when the MCU tries to execute an HCI read, but the BLE core hasn't asserted the BLEIRQ line. Try waiting for a BLEIRQ interrupt, or polling the BLECIRQ bit in the BSTATUS register before calling an HCI read function.

AM_HAL_BLE_STATUS_SPI_NOT_READY 

This error means that the MCU tried to execute an HCI write, but the BLE core didn't assert its SPI_STATUS signal within the allotted timeout. This might mean that there has been some error inside the BLE core. This may require a reboot of the BLE core.

◆ am_hal_ble_default_trim_set()

uint32_t am_hal_ble_default_trim_set ( void *  pHandle)

Sets the default trim values for the BLE core.

Parameters
pHandleis the BLE module handle

This function reads the default trim values for the BLE core from non-volatile memory, and writes them to the BLE core registers. Specifically, this function adjusts the BLE core bandgap voltage, bandgap current, and memory-retention LDO voltage based on chip-specific, manufacturer-determined settings.

Note
For best performance and power consumption, this function should be called after the patching process is complete, but before normal HCI operation begins.
Returns
BLE status code.

bool  enable 
)

Generate continuously moderated signal for SRRC/CE test.

◆ am_hal_ble_set_constant_transmission_ex()

uint32_t am_hal_ble_set_constant_transmission_ex ( void *  pHandle,
uint8_t  channel 
)

Generate continuously moderated signal for SRRC/CE test on a specified rf channel.

Parameters
pHandle- is the Handle for the BLE module.
channel- 0 to 0x27 for a valid radio channnel while 0xff to set radio transmit mode to normal.

This function calls am_hal_ble_set_constant_transmission() and send HCI test command with channel information to BLE controller.

Returns
BLE status code.
